unnormalised: EdTech Startup 'ShikshaNow' Secures $5M in Series A Funding
normalised: EdTech Startup 'ShikshaNow' Secures dollar five million in Series A Funding

unnormalised: Mumbai, 16/10/2024 – ShikshaNow, a rapidly growing EdTech startup focused on personalized online learning solutions, has successfully closed its Series A funding round, securing $5 million from a consortium of investors led by 'EduVentures India'. The capital infusion will primarily be used to expand ShikshaNow’s reach into Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities, enhance its AI-powered learning platform, and develop new course offerings tailored to the Indian market, according to a press release issued at 11:00 AM today.
normalised: Mumbai, sixteenth October two thousand and twenty four – ShikshaNow, a rapidly growing EdTech startup focused on personalized online learning solutions, has successfully closed its Series A funding round, securing dollar five million from a consortium of investors led by 'EduVentures India'. The capital infusion will primarily be used to expand ShikshaNow’s reach into Tier two and Tier three cities, enhance its A-I-powered learning platform, and develop new course offerings tailored to the Indian market, according to a press release issued at eleven zero zero A-M today.

unnormalised: Founded in 2020 by IIT Delhi alumni Rohan Sharma and Aisha Khan, ShikshaNow has quickly gained traction with its innovative approach to online education, focusing on adaptive learning pathways and vernacular content. The platform currently offers courses in fields ranging from coding and data science to digital marketing and spoken English, catering to students from Class 6 to undergraduates. The startup reported a 300% increase in user base over the past 12 months, now serving over 2.5 lakh students across India.

The startup reported a three hundred percent increase in user base over the past twelve months, now serving over two point five lakh students across India.

unnormalised: 'EduVentures India', a prominent venture capital firm specializing in the education sector, expressed strong confidence in ShikshaNow's potential. "We are impressed by ShikshaNow's commitment to providing accessible and high-quality education to students across India. Their personalized learning platform and focus on vernacular content are particularly compelling," said Mr. Sanjay Patel, CEO of EduVentures India. "We believe ShikshaNow is well-positioned to become a leading player in the Indian EdTech market."

unnormalised: ShikshaNow plans to utilize the fresh capital to introduce new features such as live doubt-clearing sessions, interactive simulations, and career counseling services. The startup also aims to partner with leading educational institutions and industry experts to develop specialized courses in emerging fields such as AI, blockchain, and cybersecurity. Furthermore, ShikshaNow intends to expand its team by hiring experienced educators, technology professionals, and marketing specialists.

unnormalised: With the Indian EdTech market projected to reach $10 billion by 2025, ShikshaNow's successful funding round underscores the growing investor confidence in the sector. The startup's focus on personalized learning, vernacular content, and expansion into underserved markets positions it for continued growth and success in the years to come, as stated by Ms. Khan in a live interview at 7:00 PM today with 'EdTech Times'.
